result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on January 30, 2023 at 10:00 am.

9:53 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Kenyotta S Evans in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Kenyotta S Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kershek provides an update; he needs time to review the medical reports and allow time for his client to complete some of her parenting classes.  Atty. Kershek requests a further proceedings date in about 90 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

3:10 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenyotta S Evans in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Kenyotta S Evans. Atty. Kershek provides an update; he notes he filed a letter with the court advising he is still waiting to review the CARE center interviews and as such is not prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing today.  Atty. Kershek requests a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:22 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenyotta S Evans in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Kenyotta S Evans.  Atty. Kershek provides an update, he is requesting a new plea and sentencing date in about 3 weeks.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:42 AM Defendant Kenyotta S Evans in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Kenyotta S Evans. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.

Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Arraignment on August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:03 AM Defendant Kenyotta S Evans in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Steven Guth, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Tempelis.
Cross examination by attorney Kershek.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Attorney Kershek requests an arraignment date.
The Court will adjourn the matter back before itself.  Arraignment scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed by Atty Kershek

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Mark Kershek
Status conference on July 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:46 AM Defendant Kenyotta S Evans in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant states she was told by the Public Defender's Office that an attorney would be present today.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  The Court will set a status conference the day prior and allow for the defendant to appear by Zoom at the status date ONLY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Hearing on July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victims/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to discipline with any child.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

02:17 PM Defendant Kenyotta S Evans in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
